        Thanks for the report. I suspect this, <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I suspect this, <!----></span>Issue 1232404<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232404" title="global buffer overflow in printing::PrintPreviewUI::OnInitiatorClosed(use devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232404<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232408<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232408" title="uaf in  DownloadShelfUI::~DownloadShelfUI (devtools )"><!---->Issue 1232408<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232409<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232409" title="uaf in  TabSearchUI::~TabSearchUI (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232409<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232425<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232425" title="global-over-flow in printing::PrintPreviewUI::OnPrintPreviewDialogClosed (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232425<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232448<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232448" title="uaf in subtle::PrefMemberBase::Destroy (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232448<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>are all caused by the same underlying problem: navigating the chrome://print WebUI via devtools remote debugging. The print preview page appears to have all the wiring to listen to navigations for its initiator, so maybe devtools navigation is skipping that somehow?<span class="line"><!---->are all caused by the same underlying problem: navigating the chrome://print WebUI via devtools remote debugging. The print preview page appears to have all the wiring to listen to navigations for its initiator, so maybe devtools navigation is skipping that somehow?<!----></span><br><br>+folks who've touched chrome/browser/ui/webui/print_preview/print_preview_ui.cc recently, do you mind taking a look? I will cc you on the other bugs I've mentioned as well, please feel free to dedupe if necessary. Also +devtools folks if they're helpful.<span class="line"><!---->+folks who've touched chrome/browser/ui/webui/print_preview/print_preview_ui.cc recently, do you mind taking a look? I will cc you on the other bugs I've mentioned as well, please feel free to dedupe if necessary. Also +devtools folks if they're helpful.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        #17: we look at things from the point of view of the fix. If the same fix addresses multiple bugs, we consider those bugs to be equivalent. We try our best to reasonably split things out where it makes sense. In this case, while you've gotten several different crashes and stack traces here, they all look like the exact same underlying problem: the chrome://print dialog isn't correctly handling navigations. If we do find that one of these is caused by a different problem, we will split it back out independently.<span class="line"><!---->#17: we look at things from the point of view of the fix. If the same fix addresses multiple bugs, we consider those bugs to be equivalent. We try our best to reasonably split things out where it makes sense. In this case, while you've gotten several different crashes and stack traces here, they all look like the exact same underlying problem: the chrome://print dialog isn't correctly handling navigations. If we do find that one of these is caused by a different problem, we will split it back out independently.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $2,000 for this report. The reward amount decided was based on this issue being significantly mitigated by not being remote accessible, user interaction required, and in progress mitigations from ongoing work (<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $2,000 for this report. The reward amount decided was based on this issue being significantly mitigated by not being remote accessible, user interaction required, and in progress mitigations from ongoing work (<!----></span>issue 1232509<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232509" title="Remove DevTools discovery page served by HTTP server on remote-debugging-port"><!---->issue 1232509<!----></a>). Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->).         Thanks for the report. I suspect this, <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I suspect this, <!----></span>Issue 1232404<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232404" title="global buffer overflow in printing::PrintPreviewUI::OnInitiatorClosed(use devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232404<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232408<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232408" title="uaf in  DownloadShelfUI::~DownloadShelfUI (devtools )"><!---->Issue 1232408<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232409<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232409" title="uaf in  TabSearchUI::~TabSearchUI (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232409<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232425<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232425" title="global-over-flow in printing::PrintPreviewUI::OnPrintPreviewDialogClosed (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232425<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232448<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232448" title="uaf in subtle::PrefMemberBase::Destroy (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232448<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>are all caused by the same underlying problem: navigating the chrome://print WebUI via devtools remote debugging. The print preview page appears to have all the wiring to listen to navigations for its initiator, so maybe devtools navigation is skipping that somehow?<span class="line"><!---->are all caused by the same underlying problem: navigating the chrome://print WebUI via devtools remote debugging.         Re: <span class="line"><!---->Re: <!----></span>comment 3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c3"><!---->comment 3<!----></a>, I agree that these all look like the same underlying issue.  I think these navigations happening within the Print Preview dialog are not supposed to be allowed for that nested run loop.  I think the correction will be for such navigations to be blocked in this case.<span class="line"><!---->, I agree that these all look like the same underlying issue.         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1232402#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 26, 2021, 9:46 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1232402#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 26, 2021, 9:46 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        #17: we look at things from the point of view of the fix. If the same fix addresses multiple bugs, we consider those bugs to be equivalent. We try our best to reasonably split things out where it makes sense. In this case, while you've gotten several different crashes and stack traces here, they all look like the exact same underlying problem: the chrome://print dialog isn't correctly handling navigations. If we do find that one of these is caused by a different problem, we will split it back out independently.<span class="line"><!---->#17: we look at things from the point of view of the fix. If the same fix addresses multiple bugs, we consider those bugs to be equivalent. We try our best to reasonably split things out where it makes sense. In this case, while you've gotten several different crashes and stack traces here, they all look like the exact same underlying problem: the chrome://print dialog isn't correctly handling navigations. If we do find that one of these is caused by a different problem, we will split it back out independently.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 20<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1232402#c20">Comment 20<!----></a>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $2,000 for this report. The reward amount decided was based on this issue being significantly mitigated by not being remote accessible, user interaction required, and in progress mitigations from ongoing work (<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $2,000 for this report. The reward amount decided was based on this issue being significantly mitigated by not being remote accessible, user interaction required, and in progress mitigations from ongoing work (<!----></span>issue 1232509<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232509" title="Remove DevTools discovery page served by HTTP server on remote-debugging-port"><!---->issue 1232509<!----></a>). Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->). Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I suspect this, <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I suspect this, <!----></span>Issue 1232404<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232404" title="global buffer overflow in printing::PrintPreviewUI::OnInitiatorClosed(use devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232404<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232408<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232408" title="uaf in  DownloadShelfUI::~DownloadShelfUI (devtools )"><!---->Issue 1232408<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232409<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232409" title="uaf in  TabSearchUI::~TabSearchUI (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232409<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232425<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232425" title="global-over-flow in printing::PrintPreviewUI::OnPrintPreviewDialogClosed (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232425<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>Issue 1232448<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1232448" title="uaf in subtle::PrefMemberBase::Destroy (devtools)"><!---->Issue 1232448<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>are all caused by the same underlying problem: navigating the chrome://print WebUI via devtools remote debugging. The print preview page appears to have all the wiring to listen to navigations for its initiator, so maybe devtools navigation is skipping that somehow?<span class="line"><!---->are all caused by the same underlying problem: navigating the chrome://print WebUI via devtools remote debugging.         I think these bug should be set as high, cause my steps in video may could be reproduced by the chrome extension api(chrome.debugger), the api could attach the print view tab, and can send other commands like (page navigate, and may could execute js). here is the devtools protocol(<span class="line"><!---->I think these bug should be set as high, cause my steps in video may could be reproduced by the chrome extension api(chrome.debugger), the api could attach the print view tab, and can send other commands like (page navigate, and may could execute js). here is the devtools protocol(<!----></span>https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/"><!---->https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> well, just my opinion, I haven't try it.<span class="line"><!----> well, just my opinion, I haven't try it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #17: we look at things from the point of view of the fix. If the same fix addresses multiple bugs, we consider those bugs to be equivalent. We try our best to reasonably split things out where it makes sense. In this case, while you've gotten several different crashes and stack traces here, they all look like the exact same underlying problem: the chrome://print dialog isn't correctly handling navigations. If we do find that one of these is caused by a different problem, we will split it back out independently.<span class="line"><!---->#17: we look at things from the point of view of the fix. If the same fix addresses multiple bugs, we consider those bugs to be equivalent. We try our best to reasonably split things out where it makes sense. In this case, while you've gotten several different crashes and stack traces here, they all look like the exact same underlying problem: the chrome://print dialog isn't correctly handling navigations. If we do find that one of these is caused by a different problem, we will split it back out independently.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
